value.title: Age Calculation in Power BI using Power Query
value.excerpt: Power Query has a simple way of calculating the age. However, because DAX is the popular language in many calculations in Power BI, many are not aware of this function in Power Query. In this video, I am going to show you how easy is to calculate Age in Power BI using Power BI. This method is very useful

value.excerpt: Power BI dashboard and reports come with a usage metric, which you can see how users used this content. value.title: Create Row Number for Each Group in Power BI using Power Query
value.excerpt: If you want to create a row-number statically as a pre-calculation in Power BI, then Power Query has a very simple way of doing it; Add Index Column. However, the Index column creates the row number regardless of any grouping or categorization. sometimes you want to take that into account too. There

value.title: Drill Down and Up in Power BI Explained
value.excerpt: Power BI works with hierarchies very easily, and there are buttons to drill down and up. However, sometimes, these buttons are confusing for the users. value.title: Exception Reporting in Power BI Catch the Error Rows in Power Query
value.excerpt: To build a robust BI system, you need to cater for errors and handle errors carefully. If you build a reporting solution that the refresh of that fails everytime an error occurs, it is not a robust system. Errors can happen by many reasons, In this video, I’ll show you a way to catch potential errors

value.title: How to Reduce the Size of Power BI file in a few Steps
value.excerpt: One of the performance considerations of a Power BI file is to reduce the size of it as much as possible. This also helps with the speed of development, because smaller files loads faster and easier in the Power BI Desktop. One way to reduce the size significantly is to find which columns are consuming

value.title: How to Use Time and Date Dimensions in a Power BI Model

However, I got some questions in the comments about how they will be used together in a data model. In this video, I’ll explain that. value.title: Left Outer Join   What it is and how to use it in Power BI and Power Query
value.excerpt: Merging two tables is one of the fundamental operations in any BI or database system. In this video, you will learn what is LEFT JOIN and how you can apply it using Power Query and Power BI. value.title: Power BI One Slicer to filter other slicers based on Items that has value only without BI Direction

How you can find all the products that this customer purchased or all customers who have purchased this product using two separate slicers.
